title: Andre McGee, central figure in Louisville scandal, quits at UMKC
text:
Andre McGee resigned as assistant coach at University of Missouri -Kansas City on Friday, saying he no longer could do the job as he fights “false” allegations by an escort that he hired dancers to strip and have sex with recruits and players while coaching at Louisville.
Not long after McGee announced his resignation, Rick Pitino — his former boss at Louisville — said in a statement from Louisville that the Hall of Fame coach was going to skip ACC media day next week in Charlotte, N.C., on the advice of counsel because of the allegations.
McGee, a former Louisville player, served as a graduate assistant and director of men’s basketball operations at the school before coming to UMKC in 2014.
“The university deserves a full-time assistant coach and I am not able to provide that to the basketball team while the false allegations against me are being investigated,” McGee wrote in his resignation letter.
The escort, Katina Powell , appeared on ABC’s “The View” on Friday with her daughters. Powell wrote in “Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen” that McGee paid her $10,000 for 22 shows from 2010 through ’14 with many taking place at the players’ dormitory.
Pitino has denied knowledge of the activities described in Powell’s book.
